meanings.definition: To direct too much or excessively.
meanings.sent1: She kept overdirecting the actors during the play rehearsal.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overdirect when he is in charge of a project.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was overdirecting the students so much that they felt overwhelmed.
meanings.sent4: Her constant overdirecting was like trying to control a runaway train.
meanings.sent5: The coach's overdirecting made the team's performance suffer.

meanings.definition: The act of giving too many directions or instructions.
meanings.sent1: The overdirecting of the boss confused the employees.
meanings.sent2: Overdirecting in a team can lead to inefficiency and confusion.
meanings.sent3: The overdirecting at the meeting made everyone laugh at the chaos.
meanings.sent4: The overdirecting in the kitchen was like a symphony of conflicting orders.
meanings.sent5: The overdirecting of the tour guide made the sightseeing experience unpleasant.
